intro: Trichomanes sinuosum, commonly known as the sinuous maidenhair fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, delicate fern characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its leaves are usually bright green and have a leathery texture. Trichomanes sinuosum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
